p: The collected isolates were thawed and cultured on blood and chocolate agar plates. Differential media of cystine–lactose–electrolyte-deficient agar (CLED) (Oxoid Ltd., Basingstoke, UK), deoxycholate citrate agar (DCA) (Neogen Co. Ltd. Lansing, MI, USA), and MacConkey agar (Sigma-Aldrich Inc., St. Louis, MO, USA) aided in distinguishing between Gram negative bacteria that are lactose fermenters (LF) and non-lactose fermenters (NLF). The isolates were ascertained based on colonial morphology, Gram staining and a battery of biochemical reactions, as defined by Ryan and Ray [ 21].
